title: Protonmail Error-Current Operation on Inbox Did Not Succeed-Mail Server for Account Responded No Such Mailbox
content:
When opening the Inbox for my Protonmail address, Thunderbird has the following error: "The current operation on "Inbox" did not succeed. The mail server for account "xxxx@protonmail.com" responded: no such mailbox." All other mailbox folders for the address are working (i.e. sending, receiving and syncing without error). This started after upgrading to Version 115.3.1 "Supernova". I am running Thunderbird in Windows 10. Clicking on "Repair Folder" in Folder Properties did not help and produced the same error.

Any help correcting this is greatly appreciated.
creator: AnotherMigraine

title: Search bar function opens waaaaay too many emails
content:
Here is a quote from What's New In Thunderbird 115:

Click a message in the search results to view it.

It will open in a new tab, along with other messages that have the same Subject.

Your original search will be left unchanged in the search tab, so you can go back and continue searching


That second sentence is the problem -- "along with other messages etc"

I would like to be able to click on ONE of the messages that comes up in search, and not have ALL of them open in separate tabs or windows. This is a huge fail. Such a nuisance to have to close a whole bunch of messages that I didn't intend to open in the first place.

Some help with this Please?
creator: bluetreesgreentrees

creator: shop01

title: MS Exchange (Outlook) account disappearing when exiting Thunderbird
content:
Sorry this post is a bit verbose !

Thunderbird automatically updated two days ago, version now 115.3.2. I use it to work with a number of mail accounts, including an MS Exchange account. All worked OK before the Thunderbird update. Exquilla version is 115.3 and paid up.

After the Thunderbird update I found that the MS Exchange account had disappeared from Thunderbird. Re-adding this account through the Account Wizard appeared to work OK. But after successfully verifying my account, on the final "Congratulations window" it said to click Finish to save settings and exit account wizard. There was no Finish button to click on, only Back, Next and Cancel ones (see screenshot). Clicked Next : window disappeared.

And yes the MS Exchange account was then accessible in Thunderbird, and it synced OK (it's all still there online), and I could work with it, but only as long as I didn't exit Thunderbird ! When I re-loaded Thunderbird later after exiting it, the MS Exchange account was absent again. Contrary to what was stated, the account had not been saved. Tried this several times - same result.

This issue only affects my MS Exchange account : none of my gmail accounts nor my Xtra account were affected.

Have other people had the same problem ? If so, is this being looked into ? It would be very annoying to have to add the MS Exchange account again each time I load Thunderbird.

Thanks a lot for any help, Emile.
creator: ejbax

title: Pasting image into email error - 'Thunderbird has blocked a file from loading into this message'
content:
When pasting an image into a message, copied to the clipboard from another email message in Thunderbird, I get an error message saying 'Thunderbird has blocked a file from loading into this message. Unblocking the file will include it in your sent message.'

This is not a remote file, it has just been copied from another Thunderbird message into the clipboard. There is an Options button which shows the file location showing mailbox:///c:/users/(username etc).

In Tools/Settings/Privacy/Mail Content, I have ticked the 'Allow remote content in messages.'

In Exceptions, I have tried to add 'mailbox:///c:/users/' as a permitted location. Doesn't help. I still get the error message. It's a nuisance to have to dismiss it every time.

This is a new problem since upgrading to 115.3.1 (64-bit)

Thanks for your help.
creator: brianstokes

title: T-bird 115 supernova.. are you kidding?
content:
been a T-Bird user since day one when it first came out many many years ago.. what you have done with this Supernova version is a disgrace.. total garbage... if it ain't broke don't fix it.. to say this has been a BAD update experience is not even close to what I have to say.. bring back the 'old user-friendly T-Bird'

'Get Messages' for just one account is now impossible.. if anyone has a solution that actually works I'd like to know about it.. been thru the Settings then Advance option.. nada.. does not solve the problem..
creator: stakeouttoo
